revised_title: Improvement in Lighthouse Illumination: The Lime Ball Experiment
tldr: The author, Thomas Drummond, describes an improvement in lighthouse illumination by replacing the Argand burner with a small ball of lime ignited by oxygen and hydrogen. This new method was tested at the Trinity House and found to be more effective than traditional methods. The lime ball light produced distinct shadows and a long stream of rays that could be seen from a distance, making it easier to spot the light even when it was not directly visible.
